com.receiver2d.engine.graphics

Class Texture2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.receiver2d.engine.graphics.Texture2D

  • public class Texture2D
extends Object
    A Texture2D is a general-purpose texture useful for entities, skyboxes, and anything else that may need a texture. In contrast to an Entity, a Texture2D augments anything that is being rendered by specifying an additional color or image data to be drawn on by the Renderer, as specified.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Color bgColor
      The background color of the texture, which is rendered with first priority.
      static int BYTES_PER_PIXEL
      Bytes per pixel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Texture2D()
      Creates a new texture with size 1 in all dimensions and a background color of white.

      Creates a new Texture2D from a BufferedImage and color values.

      Creates a new Texture2D from a BufferedImage and a Color.
      Texture2D(float width, float height, byte r, byte g, byte b, byte a)
      Creates a new Texture2D from dimensional and color values.
      Texture2D(float width, float height, Color color)
      Creates a new Texture2D from dimensional and color values.
      Texture2D(R2DResource res, byte r, byte g, byte b, byte a)
      Creates a texture from a resource and color values.

      Creates a texture from a resource.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bind()
      Assuming this texture's ID has already been initialized, binds the texture to OpenGL again for reuse.
      void bind(List<Integer> bindings)
      This method binds the texture to OpenGL and sets the item located at the index of the binding array to that value.
      ByteBuffer getBuffer()
      Gets a ByteBuffer from the texture's image, which is useful for rendering to the display:
      ByteBuffer buffer = getBuffer();
      glTexImage2D(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, GL_AMBIENT, (int)tex.width(), (int)tex.height(), 0, GL_RGBA, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, buffer); Do note that the buffer is auto-flipped here, so implementing code need not flip the buffer returned by this method.
      BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
      Gets the buffered image of this texture.
      float[] getColor()
      Gets the texture's background color.
      Image getScaled()
      The rendered image applies the dimensions of the texture to the original static image, and returns the "stretched" output.
      float height()
      Gets the texture's native height.
      int id()
      Gets the unique ID of the texture, assuming bind(List) has been called first and the texture was successfully binded to OpenGL.
      void setImage(BufferedImage i)
      Sets the current BufferedImage of the texture.
      float width()
      Gets the texture's native width.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D()
        Creates a new texture with size 1 in all dimensions and a background color of white.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(float width,
                 float height,
                 byte r,
                 byte g,
                 byte b,
                 byte a)
        Creates a new Texture2D from dimensional and color values. The choice of floating-point dimensions rather than integer values is useful for rounding stored results from geometric calculations, rather than losing this information by saving it as an (int).
        Parameters:
        width - The _rendered_ width of the texture.
        height - The _rendered_ height of the texture.
        r - The red component of the background color [0,255].
        g - The green component of the background color [0,255].
        b - The blue component of the background color [0,255].
        a - The alpha component of the background color [0,255].

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(float width,
                 float height,
                 Color color)
        Creates a new Texture2D from dimensional and color values. The choice of floating-point dimensions rather than integer values is useful for rounding stored results from geometric calculations, rather than losing this information by saving it as an (int).
        Parameters:
        width - The rendered width of the texture.
        height - The rendered height of the texture.
        color - A color object (r, g, b, a) rendered as the background.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(BufferedImage i,
                 byte r,
                 byte g,
                 byte b,
                 byte a)
        Creates a new Texture2D from a BufferedImage and color values.
        Parameters:
        i - The BufferedImage to use.
        r - A red value (0 through 255).
        g - A green value (0 through 255).
        b - A blue value (0 through 255).
        a - An alpha value (0 through 255), a 255 being completely opaque and a value of 0 being completely transparent.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(BufferedImage i,
                 Color color)
        Creates a new Texture2D from a BufferedImage and a Color.
        Parameters:
        i - The BufferedImage to use.
        color - The background color of the texture to render.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(R2DResource res,
                 Color color)
          throws IOException
        Creates a texture from a resource.
        Parameters:
        res - The resource to use.
        color - The default color of the texture.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the file does not exist.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(R2DResource res,
                 byte r,
                 byte g,
                 byte b,
                 byte a)
          throws IOException
        Creates a texture from a resource and color values.
        Parameters:
        res - The resource to use.
        r - red component
        g - green component
        b - blue component
        a - alpha component
        Throws:
        IOException - If the file does not exist.

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(BufferedImage i)
        Sets the current BufferedImage of the texture.
        Parameters:
        i - A buffered image.

      • getScaled

        public Image getScaled()
        The rendered image applies the dimensions of the texture to the original static image, and returns the "stretched" output. This usefully avoids having to store images of different dimensions.
        Returns:
        A rendered version of the texture's image.

      • getBufferedImage

        public BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
        Gets the buffered image of this texture.
        Returns:
        The texture's buffered image.

      • getBuffer

        public ByteBuffer getBuffer()
        Gets a ByteBuffer from the texture's image, which is useful for rendering to the display:
        ByteBuffer buffer = getBuffer();
        glTexImage2D(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, GL_AMBIENT, (int)tex.width(), (int)tex.height(), 0, GL_RGBA, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, buffer); Do note that the buffer is auto-flipped here, so implementing code need not flip the buffer returned by this method.
        Returns:
        A usable buffer.

      • height

        public float height()
        Gets the texture's native height.
        Returns:
        The height of the texture's image.

      • width

        public float width()
        Gets the texture's native width.
        Returns:
        The width of the texture's image.

      • getColor

        public float[] getColor()
        Gets the texture's background color.
        Returns:
        The current background color of the texture (r,g,b,a).

      • bind

        public void bind(List<Integer> bindings)
        This method binds the texture to OpenGL and sets the item located at the index of the binding array to that value.
        Parameters:
        bindings - A list of binding values.

      • bind

        public void bind()
        Assuming this texture's ID has already been initialized, binds the texture to OpenGL again for reuse.

      • id

        public int id()
        Gets the unique ID of the texture, assuming bind(List) has been called first and the texture was successfully binded to OpenGL. Valid texture IDs are unsigned integers.
        Returns:
        The texture ID, or -1 if it has yet to be binded.
